alert.note: Alert for Berkeley (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 07 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of panhandle West Virginia, including the following county: Berkeley. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 530 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Martinsburg... Martinsburg Airport... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
